subject: Travel
title: Atlantis: The Endless Search
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Atlantis: The Endless Search.

hook.text: Plato described a powerful island civilization that sank into the ocean in a single day. People have searched for it ever since.

buildup.text: In 360 BC, Plato wrote that Atlantis was a wealthy island beyond the Pillars of Hercules, now Gibraltar.

discovery.text: Candidates include Santorini, the Azores, Antarctica, and the Sahara Desert. None have been confirmed.

twist.text: Most scholars believe Plato invented Atlantis as a moral parable about the dangers of pride and greed.

climax.text: Despite this, explorers, scientists, and Netflix documentaries keep searching. The myth refuses to die.

punchline.text: The most sought-after city in history probably never existed.
